intro: Sphaerostephanos exindusiatus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Sphaerostephanos exindusiatus is often found in moist, disturbed habitats in tropical regions.
